result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

14CF929/14CF1308
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas R. Mercier, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bates request motion be adjourned as he will no longer be advocate counsel as of 8/1/15.  Request is denied and arguments heard on motion to join cases for trial.  Upon hearing arguments court grants State's motion and 14CF929 & 14CF1308 will be joined for trial.  Trial date remains as previously scheduled.

Scheduled for motion to join files 14CF929 & 14CF1308 for trial.  Motion was filed by the State the afternoon of 6/9/15 and Atty Bates has not received his copy.  Motion hearing reset for 6/30/15 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas R. Mercier, appeared with Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parise moves to withdraw at this time due to DE's failure to fulfill his obligation with no objection by the State.  Upon hearing statements court grants Atty Parise's motion to withdraw.  DE is requesting an attorney be appointed.  Court appoints Atty Gregory Bates as advocate counsel.  Jury Trial is canceled for 2/16/15 and Status Conf. on 3/20/15 at 9:50 AM.
Due to a continued jury trial; Status Conf. moved to 1/29/15 at 9:00 AM per confirmation with Atty Parise.
